intro: Scorzonera radiata, commonly known as the radiate scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is notable for being thick and fleshy, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Scorzonera radiata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
